channel.title: Cleanest least buggy source
channel.description: Which source is currently the least buggy/clean source?

item.title: Cleanest least buggy source
item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

[quote=“waj, post:22, topic:514553”][quote author=Snemo link=topic=632803.msg4284463#msg4284463 date=1366152721]

who are you even talking to? Im just glad that i ripped all your stuff from your site before your shit server went down
[/quote]lol, that just proves you’re too incompetent to do anything yourself.

Good comeback. I love it

I’ll just leave this here for you to read, no-one needs a come back with you, just look at the link.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

lol

On topic: I say MSC, mainly because the source is laid out very neatly

Read full topic

item.title: Cleanest least buggy source
item.dc:creator: @Protosstribe object
item.description:
@Protosstribe wrote:

[quote=“Snemo, post:8, topic:514553”]Your website looks great. What template did you use?[/quote]Thanks! I didn’t use a template. But, I didn’t write a lot of the HTML and CSS on my own either. It is all auto-generated by my own PHP framework.

Read full topic

item.title: Cleanest least buggy source
item.dc:creator: @Snemo Snemo
item.description:
@Snemo wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:13, topic:514553”][quote author=Snemo link=topic=632803.msg4283222#msg4283222 date=1365994552]

[quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=632803.msg4283203#msg4283203 date=1365990995]

I wish I was further than I am. But that’s life.

Currently I can pretty much log in (and log out), walk and watch bots walk around. I had following, but had to temporarily remove it in order to make it fit in with the architecture in a better way. But, I think I will soon have a primitive version of combat implemented. The Domain Model for it is pretty much finished. Other than in-game features my server supports versions 201, 202 and 203 (204), at the very same time.

One large problem I had earlier (which also took quite a lot of my time) was that I could only display 255 players at once (if you remember my last topic?). But I realized that this is a restriction in (or a design decision made for) the client itself, rather than a bug. It is probably so that computers with slow connections won’t get overwhelmed with data (or something along those lines).

As my goal with this server is more than just an empty source, and I got limited time to work on it, it will take some time. But I do have a website for it. There’s not a lot on it so far, but you could check it out once in a while if you wish. I might have added something new to it by then. You never know. The website is http://www.macroing.org/Projects/RSC4J .

Your website looks great. What template did you use?
[/quote]inb4stolen

Lol you made bro? That skill guide looks great on my site.
[/quote][quote=Dipsht]my site[/quote]Which parts?[/quote]

who are you even talking to? Im just glad that i ripped all your stuff from your site before your shit server went down

Read full topic

item.title: Cleanest least buggy source
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Most sources are by far bug free even a lot of the ones that claim to be bug free will still have a large amount of bugs and defects. Only a few projects these days are even trying to create well rounded content for the end user and those are either not all about money or are just projects to learn from.

Read full topic

item.title: Cleanest least buggy source
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“Snemo, post:8, topic:514553”][quote author=object link=topic=632803.msg4278036#msg4278036 date=1365184317]
I wish I was further than I am. But that’s life.

Currently I can pretty much log in (and log out), walk and watch bots walk around. I had following, but had to temporarily remove it in order to make it fit in with the architecture in a better way. But, I think I will soon have a primitive version of combat implemented. The Domain Model for it is pretty much finished. Other than in-game features my server supports versions 201, 202 and 203 (204), at the very same time.

One large problem I had earlier (which also took quite a lot of my time) was that I could only display 255 players at once (if you remember my last topic?). But I realized that this is a restriction in (or a design decision made for) the client itself, rather than a bug. It is probably so that computers with slow connections won’t get overwhelmed with data (or something along those lines).

As my goal with this server is more than just an empty source, and I got limited time to work on it, it will take some time. But I do have a website for it. There’s not a lot on it so far, but you could check it out once in a while if you wish. I might have added something new to it by then. You never know. The website is http://www.macroing.org/Projects/RSC4J .

item.title: Cleanest least buggy source
item.dc:creator: @Protosstribe object
item.description:
@Protosstribe wrote:

I wish I was further than I am. But that’s life.

Currently I can pretty much log in (and log out), walk and watch bots walk around. I had following, but had to temporarily remove it in order to make it fit in with the architecture in a better way. But, I think I will soon have a primitive version of combat implemented. The Domain Model for it is pretty much finished. Other than in-game features my server supports versions 201, 202 and 203 (204), at the very same time.

One large problem I had earlier (which also took quite a lot of my time) was that I could only display 255 players at once (if you remember my last topic?). But I realized that this is a restriction in (or a design decision made for) the client itself, rather than a bug. It is probably so that computers with slow connections won’t get overwhelmed with data (or something along those lines).

As my goal with this server is more than just an empty source, and I got limited time to work on it, it will take some time. But I do have a website for it. There’s not a lot on it so far, but you could check it out once in a while if you wish. I might have added something new to it by then. You never know. The website is http://www.macroing.org/Projects/RSC4J .

item.title: Cleanest least buggy source
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

[quote=“object, post:3, topic:514553”]It might be my RSC4J / FreeScape (3) source. Which unfortunately is not yet released. Although, content-wize it is still far from most servers.

I don’t really think any currently released server sources are clean. So they are quite equal in that respect. But I guess the least buggy would probably be one of the later ones. Say, for instance, MoparScape Classic. Although I havn’t tested it, so I cannot say for sure.[/quote]When are you releasing your wonderful source

item.title: Cleanest least buggy source
item.dc:creator: @Protosstribe object
item.description:
@Protosstribe wrote:

It might be my RSC4J / FreeScape (3) source. Which unfortunately is not yet released. Although, content-wize it is still far from most servers.

I don’t really think any currently released server sources are clean. So they are quite equal in that respect. But I guess the least buggy would probably be one of the later ones. Say, for instance, MoparScape Classic. Although I havn’t tested it, so I cannot say for sure.

Read full topic
